data.name: label15.Text
data.value:
This wizard sets up your PICkit 2 unit for "Programmer-To-Go" operation.
This allows code to be downloaded into EEPROM memory on-board the PICkit 2, to be programmed later into a target device - no PC or software needed! All that's required is a 5V USB power source for the PICkit 2.
Click the HELP button for more detailed information, or click NEXT to get started.

data.name: label20.Text
data.value:
If the PICkit 2 software or MPLAB attempt to connect to the PICkit 2 unit, it will exit Programmer-To-Go mode.
For information on powering the PICkit 2 when using Programmer-To-Go mode, click the HELP button.
For an overview of programming and LED error codes, click NEXT.

data.name: label22.Text
data.value: Basic Operation Steps: 1) Connect USB power to the PICkit 2 (See Help) 2) Check for Target LED blinking (PICkit 2 ready) 3) Connect PICkit 2 ICSP connector to the target. 4) Press the PICkit 2 button to begin programming During programming the "Busy" LED will remain lit. Once programming has completed, either - The Target LED blinks, indicating success - The Busy LED blinks, indicating an error. Press the PICkit 2 button to clear the error.
